name: VirtualScroller
description: VirtualScroller is a performant approach to handle huge data efficiently.

items.label: items
items.title: An array of objects to display.

item-size.label: itemSize
item-size.title: The height/width of item according to orientation.

orientation.label: orientation
orientation.title: The orientation of scrollbar, valid values are 'vertical', 'horizontal' and 'both'.

num-tolerated-items.label: numToleratedItems
num-tolerated-items.title: Determines how many additional elements to add to the DOM outside of the view. According to the scrolls made up and down, extra items are added in a certain algorithm in the form of multiples of this number. Default value is half the number of items shown in the view.

delay.label: delay
delay.title: Delay in scroll before new data is loaded.

lazy.label: lazy
lazy.title: Defines if data is loaded and interacted with in lazy manner.

disabled.label: disabled
disabled.title: If disabled, the VirtualScroller feature is eliminated and the content is displayed directly.

loader-disabled.label: loaderDisabled
loader-disabled.title: Used to implement a custom loader instead of using the loader feature in the VirtualScroller.

show-spacer.label: showSpacer
show-spacer.title: Used to implement a custom spacer instead of using the spacer feature in the VirtualScroller.

tabindex.label: tabindex
tabindex.title: Index of the element in tabbing order.

pt.label: pt
pt.title: Used to pass attributes to DOM elements inside the component.

slots.name: loader
slots.title: Custom content for the loader items.

events.name: scroll
events.title: Callback to invoke when scroll position changes.

events.name: scroll-index-change
events.title: Callback to invoke when scroll position and item's range in view changes.

arguments.name: event.first
arguments.description: First index of the new data range to be loaded.

arguments.name: event.last
arguments.description: Last index of the new data range to be loaded.

events.name: lazy-load
events.title: Callback to invoke in lazy mode to load new data.

arguments.name: event.first
arguments.description: First index of the new data range to be loaded.

arguments.name: event.last
arguments.description: Last index of the new data range to be loaded.
